title.rendered: BC PNP Latest Draw May 30 2023 ~ 196 Invitations

Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]British Columbia has announced the release of its fourth BC PNP Draw of May 2023. A total of 196 Invitations to Apply (ITAs) have been issued to Skilled Workers and International Graduates who are part of the program’s candidate pool under the British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program.

The Latest BC PNP draw, carried out under the BC PNP Skills Immigration category, aims to attract highly skilled and semi-skilled workers in occupations that are in high demand in British Columbia (BC). In addition, candidates from the Express Entry BC stream were also included in this draw.

  • Draw Date: May 30, 2023
  • No. of invitations: ~ 196
  • BC PNP Stream: Skills Immigration
  • Minimum Score: Ranging from 60-107
[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”padding-6-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” centered_text=”true” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][nectar_btn size=”large” button_style=”regular” button_color_2=”Accent-Color” icon_family=”default_arrow” text=”Start Your Free BC PNP Assessment” url=”https://bit.ly/start-free-assessment”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1685545400670{padding-bottom: 40px !important;}”]

BC PNP Latest Draw Results: May 30, 2023

The fourth BC PNP Skills Immigration draw in May 2023 specifically targeted candidates with a valid job offer in one of the eligible occupations under the program. The minimum score required for this draw ranged from 60 to 107 points across all categories.

In the latest BC PNP draw, a total of 151 Invitations to Apply (ITAs) have been granted to eligible candidates under the General Category, 11 ITAs fewer as compared to the previous draw. The ITAs have been distributed among five different applicant categories, each requiring specific minimum scores:

Date Number of
Invitations		 Stream Minimum
Score		 Description
May 30, 2023 151 Skilled Worker 104 General draw
(includes tech occupations)
Skilled Worker – EEBC option 104
International Graduate 107
International Graduate – EEBC option 107
Entry Level and Semi-Skilled 85

BC PNP Targeted Draws

The latest BC PNP targeted draws conducted by the British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program (BC PNP) have resulted in the issuance of 45 Invitations to Apply (ITAs) to eligible candidates. These ITAs have been allocated to two specific applicant categories: Childcare (Early childhood educators and assistants – NOC 42202), Healthcare, and 0ther priority occupations (NOCs 31103, 32104). Here are the minimum scores required for each category:

Date Number of
Invitations		 Stream Minimum
Score		 Description
May 30, 2023 26 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw: Childcare: Early childhood educators and assistants (NOC 42202)
May 30, 2023 14 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw: Healthcare
May 30, 2023 <5 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw:
Other priority occupations (NOCs 31103, 32104)

margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”BC PNP Skills Immigration Categories” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1669814791596{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]The Skills Immigration (SI) stream represents a key pathway for skilled workers to apply for a provincial nomination under the BC PNP. This stream is divided into various categories, including:

BC PNP Skilled Worker: The Skills Immigration (SI) stream represents a key pathway for skilled workers to apply for a provincial nomination under the BC PNP. This stream is divided into various categories, including:

BC PNP Health Authority:  The Health Authority sub-category is tailored for healthcare professionals such as physicians, nurses, psychiatric nurses, and allied health professionals. Candidates must have a job offer in an eligible healthcare occupation in British Columbia.

BC PNP International Graduate: The International Graduate sub-category is intended for individuals who have recently graduated from a Canadian university or college. Candidates must secure a job offer from a BC employer in a skilled occupation related to their field of study.

BC PNP International Post-Graduate: The International Post-Graduate sub-category is open to graduates who have completed a Master’s or Doctoral degree in natural, applied, or health sciences from an eligible British Columbia institution.

BC PNP Semi-Skilled: The Semi-Skilled sub-category is targeted at individuals who have received a job offer from a BC employer in an eligible occupation within tourism, hospitality, food processing, or long-haul trucking. Eligible candidates must meet specific language and employment requirements.

https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/blog/bc-pnp-express-entry/[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

What is Express Entry BC Stream?

The Express Entry BC (EEBC) Stream is a program that operates through a partnership between the Government of Canada’s Express Entry system and the province of British Columbia. This collaborative effort allows the province to identify potential candidates from the Express Entry pool who may be eligible for one of the EEBC streams. These streams, which are part of the British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program (BC PNP), aim to attract skilled foreign workers, international graduates, and entrepreneurs to settle in British Columbia as permanent residents.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Need help?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1655824044795{padding-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]If you are ready to begin the BC PNP process and require assistance, you can seek immigration guidance from the experienced immigration consultants at Team COLOSSUS. Mr. Keshav Sharma, a Licensed Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC), possesses comprehensive knowledge of all BC PNP programs. Their expertise can provide valuable support throughout your BC PNP application. Book a Consultation with an Expert RCIC Now

excerpt.rendered: In the BC PNP Latest Draw, British Columbia invited 196 candidates under the General and Targeted draws, with minimum scores ranging from 60 to 107 based on occupation and other factors.
